requirements.summary: Build a responsive single-page portfolio with section navigation (Hero, About, Services, Work/Projects, Testimonials, Contact).
acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders all listed sections with sensible default placeholder content in English.
Navigation allows jumping to each section (or routes to each section) on both desktop and mobile.
Layout is responsive and usable on common viewport sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop).

file_operations.description: Create the main single-page layout with all required sections (Hero/Intro, About, Services, Work/Projects, Testimonials, Contact) and anchor targets for navigation; compose UI using shadcn/ui components where helpful (e.g., Card, Button, Separator) for consistent structure. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a responsive navigation header (desktop links + mobile menu) that scrolls/jumps to each section anchor; compose UI using shadcn/ui components (e.g., Button + dropdown/sheet-style primitives if available) without editing files under frontend/src/components/ui. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add the Hero/Intro section with name + positioning statement and primary call-to-action link(s) that jump to Contact/Work; keep text in English and responsive. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add an About section with placeholder bio, credibility bullets, and compact layout suitable for mobile/desktop. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a Services section listing consulting offerings with brief descriptions and optional 'typical engagements' bullets; use consistent card/list styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add a Testimonials section that is optional but supported (render placeholder testimonials and allow easily removing/empty state); use a consistent quote/card style. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add a Contact section container and CTA layout; actual link configuration is handled by REQ-3. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the app renders the new App component and that global styling import remains in place; keep the existing app providers intact.

requirements.summary: Implement a Projects/Work section rendering portfolio items from a single typed frontend data source with graceful optional outbound links.
acceptanceCriteria: Projects render from a single editable data source in the frontend (e.g., a typed array/object) without requiring backend changes.
Each project card supports 0–2 outbound links and handles missing links gracefully.
Project cards have consistent spacing, typography, and hover/focus states.

file_operations.description: Create a single typed, editable frontend data source exporting an array of portfolio items (title, description, role/stack, and up to 0–2 outbound links) used by the Projects/Work UI.

Create a reusable project card that renders title/description/role-stack and conditionally renders 0–2 outbound links with consistent hover/focus states; compose styling using shadcn/ui components such as Card and Button where available. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create the Work/Projects section that imports the single projects data source and maps it into ProjectCard components, including responsive grid/list behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Wire the Work/Projects section into the landing page flow in the correct order and ensure it has a stable anchor id for navigation.

requirements.summary: Add a consulting-focused Contact section with configurable email, optional calendaring placeholder, and social links with safe external-link behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact section includes accessible link labels and opens external links safely (new tab with appropriate rel attributes).
Email link uses mailto: and is clearly visible on mobile.
All links can be configured via a single frontend configuration object.

file_operations.description: Create a single editable configuration object for contact details (email, optional calendaring URL placeholder, and social links like LinkedIn/X/GitHub) that the Contact section consumes.

Add a small helper component for external links that consistently applies target=_blank and appropriate rel attributes, plus accessible labeling; optionally compose with shadcn/ui link/button patterns if present. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Render the mailto: link prominently, plus optional calendaring placeholder and social links using the single contact config; use SafeExternalLink for external URLs and ensure mobile-first readability. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Define and apply a consistent consulting-appropriate theme (no blue/purple primary palette) across typography, spacing, and component styling.
acceptanceCriteria: A single theme is evident across headings, body text, buttons/links, and section backgrounds.
Primary palette does not use blue/purple as the main brand colors.
UI maintains good contrast and readable typography.

file_operations.description: Create global styles and CSS variables used by Tailwind/shadcn theming (background/foreground/primary/etc.) with a warm neutral primary palette (avoid blue/purple as primary), set base typography defaults, and ensure accessible contrast. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust Tailwind theme extensions as needed to support the chosen warm neutral palette, typography scale, and spacing consistency used across sections (keeping the existing CSS-variable-driven color system).

Apply consistent section spacing, backgrounds, and typography classes across all sections to reflect a unified theme; ensure interactive elements have clear hover/focus styles. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add basic SEO and share metadata (title, description, Open Graph, Twitter card) with easy-to-edit placeholder values.
acceptanceCriteria: Document has a meaningful title and meta description (English placeholders are acceptable).
Open Graph and Twitter card meta tags are present with placeholder values.
Metadata values are easy to find and edit in the frontend codebase.

file_operations.description: Add/adjust SEO metadata: title, meta description, Open Graph tags, and Twitter card tags using English placeholder values; keep values easy to locate and edit in this file.

requirements.summary: Include required generated static images under frontend/public/assets/generated and render them from frontend static assets.
acceptanceCriteria: All required generated images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated and are referenced by the UI.
Images render correctly on the landing page on mobile and desktop.
No backend endpoints are introduced for serving images.

file_operations.description: Add the generated image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1600x900.png for use as the hero background illustration.
Add the generated image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/logo-mark.dim_512x512.png for use as the personal logo mark.
Add the generated image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/section-divider.dim_2000x300.png for use as a subtle section divider pattern.

Reference and render frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg.dim_1600x900.png in the Hero section (as an image/background element) and frontend/public/assets/generated/logo-mark.dim_512x512.png as the logo mark with appropriate alt text and responsive behavior. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Reference and render frontend/public/assets/generated/section-divider.dim_2000x300.png between major sections (or as a repeated motif) while keeping the page responsive. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
